frameDefinitions: An Agent works on a Project so that it reaches a more advanced and desirable state.
After having worked separately for some time, two or more organizational or individual Members are now organized in an Alliance so that they may better pursue some common Purposes.
A Member is semi-permanently part of a socially constructed Group.
An Event with multiple Participants takes place.
An Employer employs an Employee whose Position entails that the Employee perform certain Tasks in exchange for Compensation.
This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, who are governed by virtue of being registered in a certain Jurisdiction.
frameExamples: Victor is <t>part</t> of the Red Crescent
MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
I <t>employed</t> him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
listRoleDefinitions: The object or idea that undergoes change due to the efforts of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The individual that brings about the development of the <fen>Project</fen>.
The time at which the progress occurs.
The location at which the the <fen>Project</fen> progresses.
The entity of which the individuals are <fen>Members</fen>.
The persons or groups belonging to the <fen>Alliance</fen>.
That group or individual which has joined the <fen>Alliance</fen> which is grammatically more prominent when the <fen>Members</fen> are presented separately.
That group or individual which has joined the <fen>Alliance</fen> which is grammatically less  prominent when the <fen>Members</fen> are presented separately.
The person who belongs to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
The time at which the <fen>Member</fen> is a member of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The location where the membership relationship holds.
The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
The role <fen>Employee</fen> denotes the person who is obligated to perform some <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> is the person (or institution) that gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Field</fen> identifies the field in which the <fen>Employee</fen> is employed.
The role <fen>Position</fen> indicates a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Task</fen> indicates the action/duty that the <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to do for the <fen>Employer</fen>.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies the time at whcih the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Place</fen> identifies the location where the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The <fen>Person</fen> is the human being.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Our</fex> alliance with Japan is the cornerstone of Asia-Pacific security strategy.
Thanks in part to their coalition <fex>with McCoy</fex>, but thanks also to their seniority and the knowledge of some of their leaders, they hold considerable influence
Two <fex>members</fex> of the Red Cross were here about a donation
Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.
<fex>I</fex> was employed by an international corporation.
<fex>I</fex> employed him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
He was employed<fex>in finance</fex> fourteen years ago.
I am employed <fex>to collect the trash</fex>.
Charles has been an employee of Microsoft <fex>since 1998</fex>!
Actually, he employed me <fex> at the downtown office </fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force Action Fund
the Paul E Singer Family Foundation
the University of Rochester Singer Prize For Excellence in Secondary Teaching
